qas.question: Where can one study nautical and marine subjects in Cork?

answers.text: The National Maritime College of Ireland

qas.question: What liberal arts type colleges are in Cork?

answers.text: Cork School of Music and Crawford College of Art and Design

qas.question: Who provides vocational training in Cork?
Who offers post-secondary education in Cork?

plausible_answers.text: The National Maritime College of Ireland

qas.question: What is the only college in Europe for Nautical Studies?
What is the largest college in Ireland?
What is the biggest provider of Vocational Training in Europe?
Griffith College Cork is the only college in Ireland where you can study what?
What is the Cork School of Music the largest provider of in the country?

plausible_answers.text: Cork School of Music and Crawford College of Art and Design

qas.question: What constituent schools are incorporated into Griffith College Cork?
What kind of Certificate does Crawford College of Art and Design offer?
What level institution is the Cork School of Music?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>The National Maritime College of Ireland<b4_0/><a0_0/> is also located in Cork and is the only college in Ireland in which <b7_0>Nautical Studies and Marine Engineering<b7_0/> can be undertaken. CIT also incorporates the <a1_0><b9_0>Cork School of Music and Crawford College of Art and Design<b9_0/><a1_0/> as constituent schools. <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>The Cork College of Commerce<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> is the largest <b10_0>post-Leaving<b10_0/> Certificate college in Ireland and is also the biggest provider of <b8_0>Vocational Preparation and Training courses<b8_0/> in the country.[citation needed] Other <b11_0>3rd level<b11_0/> institutions include <a3_0>Griffith College Cork<a3_0/>, a private institution, and various other colleges.
